text:
@shandy_defender @EnvAgencyYNE @HESCOGroup It was rather brisk 🥶

I ran out of @YorkshireTea at about 2300hrs, i was in a dark place after my hot drink supply ran dry 😭
@AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE @HESCOGroup Good work, been cold out there last couple of days.

Yesterday the @EnvAgencyYNE #FieldTeam undertook a proactive (but precautionary) temporary defence deployment.

The barrier is from @HESCOGroup is essentially interlocked heavy duty bags that we fill with stone/soil/sand & has a waterproof membrane - a rapidly deployable option. https://t.co/bjKEAIf9LY
@kevturvey @jenkt1 @EnvAgency @suffolkcc It's the same with sandy soils too when it's windy, must be tons of soil erosion

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

urls.title: Open WIMS data
urls.description: alpha This is a trial service – your feedback will help us to improve it. The data is updated within two working days of a new sample being added. We also do a complete data refresh each month which may include corrections to earlier data. The Water Quality Archive provides data on water quality measurements. Samples are taken at sampling points around England and can be from coastal or estuarine waters, rivers, lakes, ponds, canals or groundwaters. They are taken for a number of purposes including

text: and if you need to download the raw data go to the excellent @EnvAgency  Water Quality Data Portal https://t.co/grKkdg4lcP

Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

text: RT @moorsforfuture: Great to see Trish and @HelenSkelton battling the elements on @BBCCountryfile last night to champion the many benefits…

text: @EnvAgency @transportgovuk The last few days have taught us that there is no help from the councils, environment agency or water board. If you’re flooding due to the main road being flooded then no one wants to know. What a mess privatisation has cost this once great country 🇬🇧
